Cohesive Narrative: Early Establishment of Israel

Late 19th Century: Zionist Ideation and Rothschild Influence

- [[Jack Kruse, MD|Kruse]]’s View: Kruse asserts Zionism was a “Masonic ‘British’ Imperialist strategy” to control the Middle East, with the Rothschilds as financial architects (
    
    @DrJackKruse
    
    , February 15, 2025; March 18, 2025). He claims Theodor Herzl, a secular Jew, was a Rothschild-backed figurehead to rally Eastern European Jews, per Silbert’s lesson, “If you control the issuance of money, you control the world” (Relationship Redox #6: Shoes, 2019).
    
    ![](https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1738732517371305984/78dgpU8V_normal.jpg)
    
    ![](https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1738732517371305984/78dgpU8V_normal.jpg)
    
- MartyrMade’s View: In Fear & Loathing in the New Jerusalem (MartyrMade podcast, 2015–2024), Cooper describes Zionism as a response to European anti-Semitism, with Herzl’s 1897 First Zionist Congress in Basel mobilizing Jews for a homeland in Palestine. He notes early Zionists were idealistic but faced resistance from wealthy Western Jews, including the Rothschilds, who initially dismissed Herzl’s vision (Throughline NPR correction, 2024). Cooper suggests British imperial interests later co-opted Zionism.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
- [[Ian Carroll|Carroll]]’s View: Carroll claims the Rothschilds “created Israel” by funding early Zionist settlements and manipulating global finance to secure British support (
    
    @ShieldsClips
    
    , May 1, 2025). He posits their banking empire controlled both sides of geopolitical conflicts to establish a Jewish state as a strategic outpost.
    
    ![](https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1863684115729371136/iqCrIehj_normal.jpg)
    
- Dawson’s View: In interviews (e.g., The Anti-Neocon Report), Dawson argues Zionism was a colonial project backed by Rothschild wealth to secure Palestine for Western interests. He claims Herzl’s The Jewish State (1896) was a blueprint for displacing Palestinians, with Rothschild land purchases (e.g., 1891 in Syria) laying the groundwork.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
- Irving’s View: Irving, a Holocaust revisionist, suggests in works like Hitler’s War that early Zionists, including Herzl, were pragmatic opportunists who sought alliances with anti-Semitic powers to achieve a Jewish state. He claims Rothschilds provided financial legitimacy but were cautious to avoid backlash.
    
- Webb’s View: In One Nation Under Blackmail, Webb connects Rothschild banking to Zionist funding, alleging they used their influence over European governments to push the Zionist agenda. She frames Herzl’s Congress as a Rothschild-orchestrated move to control Jewish nationalism for geopolitical leverage.
    
- Unified Narrative: In the 1880s–1890s, Zionism emerges as a response to pogroms in Eastern Europe, led by Herzl but financed by Rothschilds to serve British imperial goals. Herzl’s Congress unites Jewish nationalists, but the Rothschilds’ selective funding (e.g., Baron Edmond de Rothschild’s land purchases) ensures control over the movement. The narrative casts Zionism as a dual project: a Jewish survival strategy and a Western colonial tool, with Palestinians as collateral damage.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    

Early 20th Century: Balfour Declaration and British Mandate

- Kruse’s View: Kruse claims the 1917 Balfour Declaration was a Fabian Society plot, written after the Ottoman Empire’s WWI collapse, to establish Palestine as a British colony for Zionist settlement (
    
    @DrJackKruse
    
    , February 15, 2025). He links it to Rothschild influence over British finance, citing Silbert’s money-power lesson.
    
    ![](https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1738732517371305984/78dgpU8V_normal.jpg)
    
- MartyrMade’s View: Cooper details the Balfour Declaration as a British promise to facilitate a Jewish “national home” in Palestine, driven by Chaim Weizmann’s lobbying and WWI strategic needs to secure Jewish support (Fear & Loathing, Episode 2). He notes Arab resistance and British duplicity, promising land to both Jews and Arabs (Throughline, 2024).
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
- Carroll’s View: Carroll asserts the Balfour Declaration was a Rothschild-dictated move to legitimize Zionist colonization, using their control over British debt to pressure the government (
    
    @ShieldsClips
    
    , May 1, 2025).
    
    ![](https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1863684115729371136/iqCrIehj_normal.jpg)
    
- Dawson’s View: Dawson argues the Declaration was a British-Rothschild conspiracy to displace Palestinians, with Weizmann as a key Zionist negotiator. He cites British betrayal of Arab allies (e.g., McMahon-Hussein Correspondence) to favor Zionist goals.
    
- Irving’s View: Irving suggests the Declaration was a pragmatic British move to curry favor with Jewish financiers like Rothschild during WWI, downplaying Zionist agency and emphasizing anti-Semitic stereotypes of Jewish financial power.
    
- Webb’s View: Webb frames the Declaration as a Rothschild-engineered deal to secure Palestine as a geopolitical asset, using their influence over Lloyd George and Balfour. She connects it to broader intelligence operations to control Middle East oil.
    
- Unified Narrative: In 1917, the Rothschilds, leveraging WWI financial pressures, secure the Balfour Declaration through Weizmann’s diplomacy, aligning Zionist aspirations with British imperialism. The Fabians, per Kruse, orchestrate this to control the post-Ottoman Middle East, ignoring Arab claims. The British Mandate (1920–1947) sees increased Jewish immigration and land purchases, escalating tensions with Palestinians, who face economic displacement.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    

1930s: [[Adolf Hitler|Hitler]], the Transfer Agreement, and [[Edward VIII]]

- Kruse’s View: In “These People Must Pay” (2:19:41–2:28:00, [https://youtu.be/yALOChgRrHQ](https://youtu.be/yALOChgRrHQ)), Kruse claims Edward VIII, a Nazi sympathizer, was forced to abdicate in 1936 to hide royal-Nazi ties, with [[Meyer Lansky]]’s mafia and Zionist intelligence pressuring British elites to support the [[1933 Transfer Agreement|Transfer Agreement]] (1932–1939), a Nazi-Zionist deal to transfer Jewish wealth to Palestine (April 19, 2025). He ties Hitler’s rise to Fabian manipulation, creating chaos to fund Zionism (
    
    @DrJackKruse
    
    , November 26, 2024).
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
- MartyrMade’s View: Cooper describes the 1930s as a desperate era for Zionists, with Hitler’s rise driving Jewish emigration to Palestine (Fear & Loathing, Episode 6). He mentions the Transfer Agreement as a pragmatic Zionist deal with Nazis to save Jews, but notes its role in fueling Palestinian unrest (MartyrMade Substack, 2020).
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
- [[Ian Carroll|Carroll]]’s View: Carroll alleges Rothschilds and Zionists collaborated with Hitler via the [[1933 Transfer Agreement|Transfer Agreement]] to finance Israel’s foundation, using Jewish suffering as leverage to secure Palestine (
    
    @ShieldsClips
    
    , May 2025).
    
    ![](https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1863684115729371136/iqCrIehj_normal.jpg)
    
- Dawson’s View: Dawson claims the Transfer Agreement was a Zionist-Nazi collusion, with Rothschilds like Lionel de Rothschild facilitating Jewish wealth transfer to undermine Palestinian landownership. He argues Hitler’s anti-Semitism was exploited by Zionists to justify colonization.
    
- Irving’s View: In Hitler’s War, Irving portrays the Transfer Agreement as evidence of Zionist opportunism, claiming Hitler allowed Jewish emigration to Palestine to weaken Britain’s Mandate while advancing Nazi economic goals. He minimizes the Holocaust’s scale to emphasize Zionist-Nazi dealings.
    
- Webb’s View: Webb suggests the Transfer Agreement was part of a Rothschild-Zionist intelligence network, using Nazi persecution to accelerate Jewish migration and fund Zionist infrastructure, with Lansky’s financial networks laundering funds.
    
- Unified Narrative: In 1932–1933, Hitler’s rise, orchestrated by Fabians and Rothschilds per Kruse and Carroll, creates a crisis for European Jews. The Transfer Agreement, negotiated by Zionists like Arlosoroff, funnels Jewish wealth to Palestine, boosting Zionist settlements. [[Edward VIII]]’s 1936 abdication, linked to his Nazi sympathies, is a Rothschild-Lansky-Zionist maneuver to protect Zionist plans, per Silbert’s money-power principle. Lansky’s mafia, Kruse’s key figure, supports Zionist funding, while Palestinian revolts (1936–1940) intensify against British-backed Jewish immigration.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    

1940s: WWII, Holocaust, and Israel’s Founding

- Kruse’s View: Kruse claims WWII was a Fabian-Rothschild-orchestrated conflict to establish Israel, with Lansky’s decentralized financial networks funding Zionist militias like Irgun and Stern Gang (These People Must Pay, 2:24:50). He sees the 1947 UN Partition Plan as a Rothschild-driven outcome, with Bitcoin’s eventual rise as Lansky’s legacy against centralized banking (June 6, 2025,
    
    @drjackkruse_btc
    
    ).
    
    ![](https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1875587162357559300/V1kXk6gX_normal.jpg)
    
- MartyrMade’s View: Cooper details WWII’s impact, with the Holocaust galvanizing global support for a Jewish state (Fear & Loathing, Episode 6). He describes Zionist militias’ violence against British and Palestinians, leading to the 1947 UN Partition Plan and 1948 Israeli independence, alongside the Palestinian Nakba (MartyrMade Substack, 2023).
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
- Carroll’s View: Carroll claims Rothschilds manipulated WWII’s outcome to secure Israel, using their influence over Truman and Stalin to pass the UN Partition Plan. He alleges Zionist militias ethnically cleansed Palestinians to establish Israel (
    
    @ShieldsClips
    
    , May 2025).
    
    ![](https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1863684115729371136/iqCrIehj_normal.jpg)
    
- Dawson’s View: Dawson argues WWII was a Zionist opportunity, with Ben-Gurion exploiting Holocaust sympathy to justify Israel’s creation. He claims Rothschild-funded militias (e.g., Haganah) committed atrocities during the 1948 Nakba to seize Palestinian land.
    
- Irving’s View: Irving minimizes the Holocaust’s scale, suggesting Zionist leaders exaggerated it to gain international support for Israel. He claims Hitler’s policies inadvertently aided Zionist migration, with Rothschilds securing UN approval via financial leverage.
    
- Webb’s View: Webb posits WWII was a Rothschild-orchestrated crisis, with Zionist intelligence (e.g., Lansky’s networks) collaborating with Allied powers to ensure Israel’s 1948 establishment. She frames the Nakba as a deliberate ethnic cleansing to secure a Jewish state.
    
- Unified Narrative: WWII, fueled by Rothschild-Fabian machinations, sees the Holocaust drive Jewish migration to Palestine. Lansky’s mafia funds Zionist militias, which escalate violence against Palestinians and British forces. Edward VIII’s earlier abdication ensures British compliance. The 1947 UN Partition Plan, backed by Rothschild influence over Truman and Stalin, leads to Israel’s 1948 declaration, with Ben-Gurion leading the charge. The Nakba displaces 700,000 Palestinians, cementing Israel as a Rothschild-Zionist stronghold, per Silbert’s money-power lesson.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    

Timeline of Key Events

- 1896–1897: Herzl publishes The Jewish State and holds First Zionist Congress, backed by Rothschild funding to rally Eastern European Jews.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
- 1917: Balfour Declaration promises Jewish “national home,” driven by Weizmann and Rothschilds, aligning with British imperial goals.
    
    ![](https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1738732517371305984/78dgpU8V_normal.jpg)
    
- 1920–1930s: British Mandate sees Jewish immigration and land purchases, sparking Arab revolts (1920, 1929, 1936–1939), per Cooper.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
- 1932–1939: Transfer Agreement moves Jewish wealth to Palestine, with Lansky’s mafia and Rothschilds facilitating, linked to Edward VIII’s 1936 abdication.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
- 1939–1945: WWII and Holocaust accelerate Zionist migration, with Lansky funding militias and Rothschilds shaping Allied policy.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
- 1947: UN Partition Plan, influenced by Rothschilds and Zionist lobbying, divides Palestine.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
- 1948: Israel declares independence under Ben-Gurion; Nakba displaces Palestinians, securing Rothschild-Zionist control.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    

Prominent Figures

- [[Adolf Hitler|Hitler]]: Orchestrated by Fabians to create chaos, his policies drive Jewish migration via the [[1933 Transfer Agreement|Transfer Agreement]], inadvertently aiding Zionism, per Kruse and Irving.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
- Rothschilds: Financial architects, funding Herzl, Balfour, and Israel’s establishment to control Middle East geopolitics, per Carroll and Webb.
    
    ![](https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1863684115729371136/iqCrIehj_normal.jpg)
    
- Zionists:
    
    - Theodor Herzl: Visionary leader, rallying Jews but controlled by Rothschilds, per Kruse.
        
        ![](data:image/png;base64,)
        
    - Chaim Weizmann: Diplomat securing Balfour Declaration, aligning Zionism with British interests, per Cooper.
        
        ![](data:image/png;base64,)
        
    - David Ben-Gurion: Military and political leader, exploiting WWII to establish Israel, per Dawson.
        
- Meyer Lansky: Mafia financier, funding Zionist militias and inspiring Bitcoin’s anti-elite framework, per Kruse.
    
    ![](https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1875587162357559300/V1kXk6gX_normal.jpg)
    
- Edward VIII: Nazi sympathizer whose 1936 abdication hides royal-Nazi ties, ensuring Zionist plans, per Kruse.
    
    ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    

Broader Narrative and Bitcoin Connection

Kruse, Cooper, Carroll, Dawson, Irving, and Webb portray Israel’s establishment as a Rothschild-Fabian-Zionist conspiracy to control the Middle East via money and geopolitics, per Silbert’s lesson. Hitler’s rise, Edward VIII’s abdication, and WWII were manipulated to drive Jewish migration and justify a Jewish state, displacing Palestinians in the Nakba. Lansky’s decentralized financial networks, resisting Rothschild banking, inspire Bitcoin, which Kruse sees as a modern rebellion against the same elites who founded Israel. This narrative casts Zionism as a colonial tool, with Bitcoin as a decentralized counterforce to reclaim sovereignty.

Tag Explanations

- event: Historical event note.
    
- zionism: Core ideology driving Israel’s establishment.
    
- rothschilds: Financial architects.
    
- fabian-society: Alleged orchestrators, per Kruse.
    
- centralized-control: Elite manipulation theme.
    
- transfer-agreement: Nazi-Zionist financial deal.
    
- balfour-declaration: British commitment to Zionism.
    
- nakba: Palestinian displacement.
    
- bitcoin-origin: Lansky’s legacy, per Kruse.
    
- money-power: Silbert’s quote on money’s control.
    
- nazi-collaboration: Alleged Zionist-Nazi dealings.
